page.title: 13HEALTH CARE
page.content: The people of the area are looked after by Doctors BURNET & McCOLL Both practise from Doune Health Centre. Patients may make appointments to attend the Centre or have home visits. Surgeries are held morning and evening on weekdays,also Saturday mornings. Both doctors visit the area regularly and there is always at least one doctor plus a district nurse/midwife on call over 24 hours. Patients requiring hospital treatment go to Stirling Royal Infirmary. Those needing nursing care, ante- or post-natal care are attended by District Nurses or Midwives from Doune or Thornhill. Children from 10 days to 5 years and the social needs of the community are looked after by Health Visitors. At present there is no known prevalent illness in this area.
